title: Veigar W bonus CDR not stacking correctly.
body:
Recently _(for some weird and unknowable reason)_, Veigar gains CDR on his W depending on how many stacks he has _(because obviously infinitely scaling damage wasn't OP enough....)_

 I do play Veigar,  and despite disagreeing with this new aspect of his kit, I must point out that the CDR isn't stacking properly _(either that or the description is worded wrong)_.

It states that per 50 stacks, you get 10% CDR on his W.
That in itself means that it should be impossible to get any number % other than a multiplication of 10.

So how come at 200 stacks exactly, I have 34%? It should be 40%.
This has happened every time I've played him, the first 50 stacks always gives 10%, but after that that it doesn't seem to add up properly.

replies.body: It doesn't state this, but it stacks multiplicatively (to be more "fair").

Ahhhh ok thanks for that!
The wording should reflect that, to distinguish it from regular CDR.
I think they have just gotten used to be allowed to word poorly and have the general public realize that and work around their shitty wording in a lot of cases to be quite honest with you.

Yea I think you might be right.

I once talked with a Rioter on a comment on the boards about how Zac's old ult was worded as a 'Knockup' when actually it was a 'knock back' _(which is a completely different result)_

And paraphrasing here, the response was along the lines of 
_"Ehhh oh well, they're close enough."_

It's multiplicative not additive. So you can never hit 100% cool down reduction. So for each stack multiply by 0.9 and then the difference between that and one. 

CDR= 0.9^(Stacks) - 1

(0.9 x 0.9 x 0.9 x 0.9) - 1 = 34.4
I assume it's 10% of the current cooldown per 50. Because, eventually, he would have 100% CDR on it, which would be broken.
